alfredsnippet.snippet:
"I believe that if 1 percent of the money now being distributed for science went to research that was of real interest to taxpayers, science would become more popular. At present, money generally goes to research sought by the scientific establishment, corporations and government bureaucracies.  The administration of science is neither democratically accountable, nor carried out in a democratic spirit. My proposal is that 99 percent of the research funds continue to be allocated in the usual way.  But I suggest that 1 percent be spent in a way that reflects the curiosity of lay people, who pay for all publicly financed research through taxes ..."

(cont'd)
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Rupert Sheldrake's Science Funding Agency - Part 1
